title: Human Universe screen font
content:
Anyne know what the typeface is that's used in the Brian Cox series? no images I'm afraid, but it's a sans serif used in the captions and subtitles...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [human.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420095020/http:/typophile.com/files/human.jpg) | 213.02 KB |
author: breckon

comments.content:
I'm afraid without any good sample, it should almost impossible to identify it.  
Don't have access to the videos but maybe you'll find a way and do some screen captures.  
- [http://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/p0276pc3/human-universe-1-apeman-sp...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420095020/http:/www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/p0276pc3/human-universe-1-apeman-spaceman "http://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/p0276pc3/human-universe-1-apeman-spaceman")  
- [http://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/p0276ppy/human-universe-2-why-are-w...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420095020/http:/www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/p0276ppy/human-universe-2-why-are-we-here "http://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/p0276ppy/human-universe-2-why-are-we-here")
Thanks Ryuk, screenshots would have been good :) just updated... looks alot like avant garde but with some very different characters: l/c g for example...

Could be Rene Bieder's [Campton](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420095020/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/rene-bieder/campton) using (at least) alternate / [a](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420095020/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/rene-bieder/campton/extra-light/glyphs.html#glyphs/607392/246).

Yes, I spot no conflicts with Kamerik 205, including \_a\_ and \_g\_.  
Don
